bug.author: karthikvadla
bug.summary: Docker build issue with r1.14 branch
bug.description:
Hi, i'm trying to build tensorflow serving image with r1.14 branch. I see below parse issue with the branch <denchmark-code>Step 21/24 : RUN bazel build --color=yes --curses=yes ${TF_SERVING_BAZEL_OPTIONS} --verbose_failures --output_filter=DONT_MATCH_ANYTHING ${TF_SERVING_BUILD_OPTIONS} tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package && bazel-bin/tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/pip && pip --no-cache-dir install --upgrade /tmp/pip/tensorflow_serving_api-*.whl && rm -rf /tmp/pip ---> Running in 486382c275ec Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it... INFO: Analysed target //tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package (26 packages loaded, 798 targets configured). INFO: Found 1 target... Target //tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package up-to-date: bazel-bin/tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package INFO: Elapsed time: 5.082s, Critical Path: 0.58s INFO: 83 processes: 83 local. INFO: Build completed successfully, 87 total actions Wed May 29 20:42:56 UTC 2019 : === Using tmpdir: /tmp/tmp.SM4La0lE8S Adding python files Adding package setup files /tmp/tmp.SM4La0lE8S /tensorflow-serving Wed May 29 20:42:56 UTC 2019 : === Building wheel (CPU) error in tensorflow-serving-api setup command: 'install_requires' must be a string or list of strings containing valid project/version requirement specifiers; Invalid requirement, parse error at "'=1.14.0r'" The command '/bin/sh -c bazel build --color=yes --curses=yes ${TF_SERVING_BAZEL_OPTIONS} --verbose_failures --output_filter=DONT_MATCH_ANYTHING ${TF_SERVING_BUILD_OPTIONS} tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package && bazel-bin/tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/pip && pip --no-cache-dir install --upgrade /tmp/pip/tensorflow_serving_api-*.whl && rm -rf /tmp/pip' returned a non-zero code: 1 </denchmark-code>
I used docker build command as below <denchmark-code>docker build \ --build-arg TF_SERVING_VERSION_GIT_BRANCH="r1.14" \ --build-arg HTTP_PROXY=${HTTP_PROXY} \ --build-arg HTTPS_PROXY=${HTTPS_PROXY} \ --build-arg http_proxy=${http_proxy} \ --build-arg https_proxy=${https_proxy} \ -f Dockerfile.devel -t tensorflow/serving:latest-devel . </denchmark-code>
Any help please.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lilao>@lilao</denchmark-link> can't we build images based of branches? just wonder how it's working with .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gautamvasudevan>@gautamvasudevan</denchmark-link> This is different question, where is tensorflow version set in tensorflow serving? I know when i set as it uses same version of tensorflow. Do we have a way to control different version of tensorflow? or any pointers to code base where this is configured automatically?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/karthikvadla>@karthikvadla</denchmark-link> Thanks for filing this issue. In the meantime I created a PR here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/serving/pull/1367>#1367</denchmark-link> to unblock you. Here is how you use it: <denchmark-code>git clone git@github.com:karthikvadla/serving.git git remote add upstream git@github.com:tensorflow/serving.git git remote add ashahba git@github.com:ashahba/serving.git </denchmark-code>
Now checkout my branch: <denchmark-code>git remote update --prune git checkout ashahba ashahba/future </denchmark-code>
and run your build command as usual: <denchmark-code>docker build --build-arg TF_SERVING_VERSION_GIT_BRANCH="master" -f Dockerfile.devel -t tensorflow/serving:latest-devel . </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ashahba>@ashahba</denchmark-link> Thank you . Will try that now.

Please check here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/serving/pull/1367#discussion_r289582625>#1367 (comment)</denchmark-link> . Your patch fixed different error i have with master branch. Still i see parse issue with branch.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/karthikvadla>@karthikvadla</denchmark-link> should be good now, since branch in was patched earlier today here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/29233>tensorflow/tensorflow#29233</denchmark-link>
Would you please try building the container with branch and let us know? Thanks.
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/karthikvadla>@karthikvadla</denchmark-link> , Are you still facing this issue? Can we close this if it is resolved on your end? Thanks!
fwiw our official docker builds are out for r1.14 (rc0) on hub.docker.com. so this is working now.
sorry did not want to close the issue, just comment.
I will test and update you.

<denchmark-code>docker build \ --build-arg TF_SERVING_VERSION_GIT_BRANCH="r1.14" \ --build-arg HTTP_PROXY=${HTTP_PROXY} \ --build-arg HTTPS_PROXY=${HTTPS_PROXY} \ --build-arg http_proxy=${http_proxy} \ --build-arg https_proxy=${https_proxy} \ -f Dockerfile.devel-mkl -t tensorflow/serving:latest-devel-mkl . </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>/tensorflow-serving Tue Jun 4 20:47:00 UTC 2019 : === Output wheel file is in: /tmp/pip DEPRECATION: Python 2.7 will reach the end of its life on January 1st, 2020. Please upgrade your Python as Python 2.7 won't be maintained after that date. A future version of pip will drop support for Python 2.7. Processing /tmp/pip/tensorflow_serving_api-1.14.0rc0-py2.py3-none-any.whl ERROR: Exception: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_internal/cli/base_command.py", line 178, in main status = self.run(options, args) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_internal/commands/install.py", line 352, in run resolver.resolve(requirement_set) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_internal/resolve.py", line 131, in resolve self._resolve_one(requirement_set, req) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_internal/resolve.py", line 345, in _resolve_one set(req_to_install.extras) - set(dist.extras) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2969, in extras return [dep for dep in self._dep_map if dep] File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3014, in _dep_map self.__dep_map = self._compute_dependencies() File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3024, in _compute_dependencies reqs.extend(parse_requirements(req)) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3085, in parse_requirements yield Requirement(line) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3094, in __init__ raise RequirementParseError(str(e)) RequirementParseError: Parse error at "'(===1.14'": Expected stringEnd The command '/bin/sh -c bazel build --color=yes --curses=yes ${TF_SERVING_BAZEL_OPTIONS} --verbose_failures --output_filter=DONT_MATCH_ANYTHING ${TF_SERVING_BUILD_OPTIONS} tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package && bazel-bin/tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/pip && pip --no-cache-dir install --upgrade /tmp/pip/tensorflow_serving*.whl && rm -rf /tmp/pip' returned a non-zero code: 2 </denchmark-code>
Am i doing anything wrong?

docker build \ --build-arg TF_SERVING_VERSION_GIT_BRANCH="r1.14" \ --build-arg HTTP_PROXY=${HTTP_PROXY} \ --build-arg HTTPS_PROXY=${HTTPS_PROXY} \ --build-arg http_proxy=${http_proxy} \ --build-arg https_proxy=${https_proxy} \ -f Dockerfile.devel-mkl -t tensorflow/serving:latest-devel-mkl .
/tensorflow-serving Tue Jun 4 20:47:00 UTC 2019 : === Output wheel file is in: /tmp/pip DEPRECATION: Python 2.7 will reach the end of its life on January 1st, 2020. Please upgrade your Python as Python 2.7 won't be maintained after that date. A future version of pip will drop support for Python 2.7. Processing /tmp/pip/tensorflow_serving_api-1.14.0rc0-py2.py3-none-any.whl ERROR: Exception: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_internal/cli/base_command.py", line 178, in main status = self.run(options, args) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_internal/commands/install.py", line 352, in run resolver.resolve(requirement_set) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_internal/resolve.py", line 131, in resolve self._resolve_one(requirement_set, req) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_internal/resolve.py", line 345, in _resolve_one set(req_to_install.extras) - set(dist.extras) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2969, in extras return [dep for dep in self._dep_map if dep] File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3014, in _dep_map self.__dep_map = self._compute_dependencies() File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3024, in _compute_dependencies reqs.extend(parse_requirements(req)) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3085, in parse_requirements yield Requirement(line) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3094, in __init__ raise RequirementParseError(str(e)) RequirementParseError: Parse error at "'(===1.14'": Expected stringEnd The command '/bin/sh -c bazel build --color=yes --curses=yes ${TF_SERVING_BAZEL_OPTIONS} --verbose_failures --output_filter=DONT_MATCH_ANYTHING ${TF_SERVING_BUILD_OPTIONS} tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package && bazel-bin/tensorflow_serving/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/pip && pip --no-cache-dir install --upgrade /tmp/pip/tensorflow_serving*.whl && rm -rf /tmp/pip' returned a non-zero code: 2
Am i doing anything wrong?
are you using the latest r1.14 sources? the === indicates you are not.

I didn't get this latest r1.14 sources ðŸ¤” , what do you mean by this? I did as below. <denchmark-code>git clone git@github.com:tensorflow/serving cd serving/tensorflow_serving/tools/docker </denchmark-code>
and then ran docker build command.

the error on should be fixed in 1.14 branch by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/serving/commit/91484e1a7087744dc7b0c5ff773b84d58dbab0d5>91484e1</denchmark-link>
so its strange that your build is seeing === in r1.14 sources.
Oh yeah i cleaned up all my docker cache and re-built with r1.14 branch. Issue resolved. Closing it now.
